question:
You are a code expert, please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Ensure that the code you generate is executable for demonstration purposes.
Please help me implement the following requirements using code, specifically using SVG. The requirement is to create: Draw a simple butterflyfish, using <path> elements to create the shape, and add a swimming animation to it.

checklist.title: Is the butterflyfish shape properly implemented using SVG <path> elements?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code uses SVG <path> elements to create an recognizable butterflyfish shape with proper anatomical features (distinctive body shape, fins, tail, eye, and characteristic butterfly pattern). Award 10 points for a complete, anatomically correct representation; 5 points if the fish is recognizable but missing some key features; 0 points if the shape is too abstract to identify as a butterflyfish.

checklist.title: Is the fish anatomy accurately represented in the SVG paths?
checklist.description: Check if the SVG implementation includes all primary anatomical elements: pointed snout, triangular dorsal fin, pectoral fins, distinctive tail, and the characteristic eyespot pattern. For each anatomical element properly implemented, award 2 points (maximum 10 points). Deduct points for any missing or poorly executed elements.

checklist.title: Is the swimming animation properly implemented?
checklist.description: Assess the swimming animation quality. A complete implementation should include: 1) Smooth side-to-side body movement (3 points), 2) Proper tail fin movement (3 points), 3) Continuous animation loop without jarring transitions (2 points), and 4) Natural speed and rhythm mimicking actual fish movement (2 points). Deduct points for stiff, unrealistic, or missing animation elements.

checklist.title: Is the SVG code optimized and well-structured?
checklist.description: Evaluate code quality focusing on: 1) Efficient path definitions using appropriate SVG commands rather than excessive points (3 points), 2) Use of groups (<g>) to organize related elements (2 points), 3) Reuse of path definitions where appropriate (2 points), and 4) Clear structure separating shape definitions from animation definitions (3 points). Deduct points for inefficient or disorganized code.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common issues (such as browser resizing, viewport changes, or animation performance optimization). Code with strong robustness should scale properly, work across modern browsers, and not cause performance issues. Give 10 points for excellent robustness, 5 points for average implementation, and 0 points if serious issues are present.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Interactive elements that respond to user input, 2. Additional environmental elements like bubbles or coral, 3. Color changes or special effects). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant path definitions or duplicate elements, 2. Unnecessarily complex animation definitions, 3. Features unrelated to the butterflyfish or its animation. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core implementation is obscured by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review code organization (such as clear comments, meaningful variable names, proper element IDs), animation implementation efficiency, and compatibility across browsers. Deduct 5 points if global styles may interfere with external elements; deduct 5 points if animations are implemented inefficiently (e.g., using CSS when SMIL would be more appropriate or vice versa); deduct 5 points if browser prefixes are missing where needed. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the visual design meet professional artistic standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows professional artistic principles: 1) Harmonious color scheme for the butterflyfish (3 points), 2) Proper proportions and balanced design (4 points), 3) Attention to detail in patterns and textures (3 points). Deduct points for garish colors, anatomically incorrect proportions, or overly simplistic representation lacking detail. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the animation smooth and natural?
checklist.description: Judge whether the animation conforms to natural fish movement: 1) Smooth transitions between keyframes with proper easing (4 points), 2) Appropriate animation speed simulating natural swimming (3 points), 3) Coordinated movement between different body parts (3 points). Deduct points for jerky movements, unnatural speed, or disconnected animation between body parts. The full score is 10 points.
